UpperArmsCBAlternatingCurl.name: Cable Alternating Curl
UpperArmsCBAlternatingCurl.preparation: Stand between or facing double low pulleys. Grasp stirrups to each side, palms facing forward.
UpperArmsCBAlternatingCurl.execution: Pull one stirrup up forward and upward toward shoulder while keeping elbow stationary. Return until arm is fully extended. Repeat on other arm, alternating between sides.
UpperArmsCBAlternatingCurl.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl and question regarding elbow position.

UpperArmsCBAlternatingSeatedCurl.name: Cable Alternating Seated Curl
UpperArmsCBAlternatingSeatedCurl.preparation: Sit on seat situated between two low pulleys down to each side. Grasp stirrups in each hand, palms facing forward.
UpperArmsCBAlternatingSeatedCurl.execution: Pull one stirrup up toward shoulder while keeping elbow stationary. Return until arm is fully extended. Repeat with other arm, alternating between sides.
UpperArmsCBAlternatingSeatedCurl.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Cables can be positioned under shoulders with ad hoc or customized set up. See Cable Seated Curl and movement performed on apparatus facing double low pulleys. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl and question regarding elbow position.

UpperArmsCBCurl.name: Cable Curl
UpperArmsCBCurl.preparation: Grasp low pulley cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
UpperArmsCBCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

UpperArmsCBBarCurl.name: Cable Bar Curl
UpperArmsCBBarCurl.preparation: Grasp low cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Stand close to cable bar.
UpperArmsCBBarCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBBarCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel slightly forward, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

UpperArmsCBCurlStirrups.name: Cable Curl (with stirrups)
UpperArmsCBCurlStirrups.preparation: Stand between or facing double low pulleys. Grasp stirrups to each side, palms facing forward.
UpperArmsCBCurlStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups forward and upward toward shoulders while keeping elbows stationary. Return until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBCurlStirrups.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart.

UpperArmsCBSeatedCurl.name: Cable Seated Curl
UpperArmsCBSeatedCurl.preparation: Sit on seat situated between two low pulleys down to each side. Grasp stirrups in each hand, palms facing forward.
UpperArmsCBSeatedCurl.execution: Pull both stirrups up toward shoulders while keeping elbows stationary. Return until arms are fully extended and repeat.
UpperArmsCBSeatedCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Cables can be positioned under shoulders with ad hoc or customized set up. Also see Cable Alternating Seated Curl.

UpperArmsCBOneArmCurl.name: Cable One Arm Curl
UpperArmsCBOneArmCurl.preparation: Face low pulley and grasp stirrup cable attachment to one side with underhand grip.
UpperArmsCBOneArmCurl.execution: With elbow to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
UpperArmsCBOneArmCurl.comments: An alternative method is to stand facing with side of exercise arm toward low pulley. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl and question regarding elbow position.

UpperArmsCBSupineCurl.name: Cable Supine Curl
UpperArmsCBSupineCurl.preparation: Sit on floor with feet or heels against pulley machine. Grasp low pulley cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Lie back on floor with arms to sides.
UpperArmsCBSupineCurl.execution: With elbows to side, pull bar until elbows are flexed. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBSupineCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel upward, slightly allowing forearms to be no more than horizontal in this lying posture. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl and question regarding elbow position.
